Breeding male.description: Breeding male American Goldfinches can be easily separated from Lesser Goldfinches by their partial black crown and bright yellow back.

Breeding female.description: Female American Goldfinches have white undertail coverts unlike Lesser Goldfinches, which have yellowish undertail coverts. American Goldfinches also lack the Lesser's white rectangular patch on the wings.

Nonbreeding male.description: Nonbreeding male American Goldfinches are browner overall than Lesser Goldfinches. They also have white undertail coverts, whereas Lesser Goldfinches have yellowish undertail coverts.

Male.description: Lawerence's Goldfinches are gray-bodied unlike Lesser Goldfinches which have yellow underparts and either an olive or black back.

Female.description: Female Lawrence's Goldfinches a gray belly and yellow wingbars unlike Lesser Goldfinches, which have a yellow belly and whitish wingbars.

Adult (Northern).description: Pine Siskins are heavily streaked above and below unlike the unstreaked Lesser Goldfinch.

Adult male.description: Evening Grosbeaks are nearly twice the size of Lesser Goldfinches, with a much thicker, pale bill.
